messages.subject: Pam Laricchia's #3 book
messages.msgSnippet: Because Pam Laricchia introduced her book at ALLive in Minnesota, an Always Learning Live symposium, I feel a little godmotherish or somethingùlike I was
messages.messageBody:
Because Pam Laricchia introduced her book at ALLive in Minnesota, an Always Learning Live symposium, I feel a little godmotherish or something—like I was there while it was still damp, or something. Vague mushy feeling. :-)

I'm honored that she chose that event in Rochester where she and Alex and I spoke to launch Life through the Lens of Unschooling.


Pam wrote:
It's been great fun putting it together—the print book is a whopping 309 pages!

And as a thanks to you guys for being a part of the community, I have a special launch price of $2.99US for the ebook and $11.99US for the print edition (you're welcome to share it at the introductory price with your groups and communities as well). In about a week they will go to their regular list prices of $4.99US and $13.99US, respectively.

+++++++++++++++

Amazon being mysterious. they have listed it for a dollar less than that, even. I could be irritated with Amazon (which I sometimes am, because they undercut my price on their site, with some of my own books :-) ), OR BETTER... I could let you know that at least the American offering is even less than Pam listed.

http://www.amazon.com/Life-through-Lens-Unschooling-Companion/dp/0987733370/

Europeans can get it from amazon.co.uk
£7.14
http://www.amazon.co.uk/Life-through-Lens-Unschooling-Companion/dp/0987733370/

And anyone anywhere, I think, can get a kindle version (or iPad, if you download the kindle reader).
http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=ntt_athr_dp_sr_1?_encoding=UTF8&field-author=Pam%20Laricchia&search-alias=digital-text

Sandra
